AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia: Defendant convicted of aiding and abetting the transportation of undocumented aliens, subject of a suppression motion regarding the stop and search of her vehicle, driver of the stopped pickup camper, appellant in the current case, appellant contesting the district court's refusal to allow post-verdict discovery through juror depositions
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.GARWOOD: Circuit Judge presiding over the appeal
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Stanley Pruszenski: United States Border Patrol agent involved in the traffic stop of a suspicious pickup truck camper on Interstate Highway 35, driving the patrol car, observed unwashed and unkempt occupants, had reason to suspect the presence of illegal aliens due to various factors including the vehicle's appearance and occupant behavior
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alfred Baron: United States Border Patrol agent involved in the traffic stop of a suspicious pickup truck camper on Interstate Highway 35, observed the truck and its passengers, did not testify to having reason to believe the vehicle came from the border, testified about recent apprehensions of illegal alien smugglers, had reason to suspect the presence of illegal aliens due to various factors including the vehicle's appearance and occupant behavior
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Stanley Pruszenski and Alfred Baron: Agents who jointly conducted the field investigation and observed the suspicious vehicle, applied the Brignoni-Ponce standard in their assessment, had reason to suspect the presence of illegal aliens due to various factors including the vehicle's appearance and occupant behavior
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Brignoni-Ponce: Namesake of a test regarding reason to believe a vehicle came from the border, used as a standard for suspicion in this case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia, Lourdes Rangel-Ca: Individuals present in the vehicle stopped by agents Pruszenski and Baron
